basic.description: An introduction to basic anatomy and physiological principles with emphasis on the clinical relevance of the structure and function of human body systems. Topics include nerve, sensory, skeleto-muscular, respiratory, cardiovascular, renal, endocrine and digestive systems. Admission restricted to students in the B.N.Sc. program. 2 terms;  3 hours lecture per week, 2 hours tutorial alternate weeks; 6 credit units course weight.
basic.subject: IDIS
basic.title: Intro To Anatomy & Physiology
